## curve() function

Iterator producing an exponential curve (with adjustable curvature) between `start` and `end` values over `num` steps. This is the exponential equivalent of [line](./transducers.line.md)<!-- -->.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function curve(start: number, end: number, steps?: number, rate?: number): Generator<number, void, unknown>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  start | <code>number</code> |  |
|  end | <code>number</code> |  |
|  steps | <code>number</code> |  |
|  rate | <code>number</code> |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

`Generator<number, void, unknown>`

## Remarks

Since `start` is the first value emitted, the `end` value is only reached in the `num+1`<!-- -->th step.

The curvature can be controlled via the logarithmic `rate` param. Recommended range \[0.0001 - 10000\] (curved -<!-- -->&gt; linear). Default: 0.1

Similar functionality (w/ more options) is availble here: [curve](./dsp.curve.md)<!-- -->.

## Example


```ts
[...curve(50, 100, 10, 2)]
// [
//   50,
//   73.193,
//   85.649,
//   92.339,
//   95.932,
//   97.861,
//   98.897,
//   99.454,
//   99.753,
//   99.913,
//   100
// ]

```
